poem:
Title: "Rescue in Gaza"

In the dust of conflict,
four notes were lost - 
plucked from harmony's fretboard. 
On a red October, Palestine's sun bore witness, 
Nova's quartet seized. 

Yet under a Zeus-bolt sky,
a rescue, as crisp as pomegranates
and swift as oleander shadows.
Three men, one woman, arise - 
their melodies now graced with liberty's refrain.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel-Gaza war: four hostages from Nova music festival rescued in central Gaza – as it happened 4.05pm BST Summary It is just after 6pm in Gaza and Tel Aviv. Here is a recap of the key events from today: Israeli forces have rescued four hostages alive from the central Gaza Strip on Saturday, the military said. The four hostages, three male and one woman, had been kidnapped from the Nova music festival on 7 October". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Israel-Gaza war: four hostages from Nova music festival rescued in central Gaza – as it happened 4.05pm BST Summary It is just after 6pm in Gaza and Tel Aviv. Here is a recap of the key events from today: Israeli forces have rescued four hostages alive from the central Gaza Strip on Saturday, the military said. The four hostages, three male and one woman, had been kidnapped from the Nova music festival on 7 October
